text: Mebane is a city located mostly in Alamance County, North Carolina, United States, and partly in Orange County, North Carolina. The town was named for Alexander Mebane, an American Revolutionary War general and member of the U.S. Congress. It was made as "Mebanesville" in 1881, and in 1883 the name was changed to "Mebane". It was named as a city in 1987. The population as of the 2020 census was 17,797. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Cities in North Carolina
title: Mebane, North Carolina
